subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Dragon
entries: Druids of the Circle of the Dragon devote themselves to the natural balance of all dragons, good and evil. Some worship beings such as {@deity Bahamut|Dawn War|DMG} or {@deity Tiamat|Dawn War|DMG} in a quest to gain divine ascension and draconic power. Whatever their motives, these druids carry a flaming passion and extraordinary pride.

subclassFeature.name: Emissary of the Dragon
entries: At 2nd level, you learn to speak, read, and write {@language Draconic}, and when you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to dragons, you can add double your proficiency to the check. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Forms
entries: The rites of your circle grant you the ability to transform into the most feared creatures in all the realms. Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Wild Shape to transform into {@filter a dragon with a challenge rating as high as 1|bestiary|challenge rating=[;&1]|type=dragon}, ignoring the Max. CR column of the Beast Shapes table. This includes dragons you have not seen before. Additionally, you can transform into a dragon that has movement speeds from the Limitations column of the Beast Shapes table, but you cannot use those movement speeds until you've reached the appropriate druid levels shown on the table.
Starting at 6th level, you can transform into a dragon with a challenge rating as high as your druid level divided by 3, rounded down.
{@filter Official Dragons by Challenge Rating (up to CR 6).|bestiary|challenge rating=[;&6]|type=dragon}

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Breath Evolution
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you use your Wild Shape to transform into a creature that does not have a breath weapon, you can add one to its stat block. This breath weapon must be from the stat block of a dragon that you are able to transform into, such as the {@creature Bronze Dragon Wyrmling|MM|Bronze Dragon Wyrmling's Lightning Breath}.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Draconic Form
entries: At 10th level, you can expend two uses of Wild Shape to transform into a {@creature Druidic Dragon|DrdCrcDrg}. When you do so, choose a type of dragon from the {@table Draconic Essence|DrdCrcDrg|Draconic Essence table}. Your breath weapon, bite, damage immunity, and eye color while transformed are determined by the dragon type.

subclassFeature.name: Druidic Dragon Wings
entries: At 14th level, you gain the ability to sprout a pair of Druidic Dragon Wings from your back, gaining a flying speed equal to your current speed. You can create these wings as a bonus action on your turn. They last until you dismiss them as a bonus action on your turn in any physical form.
You can't manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them, and clothing not made to accommodate your wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Rule: Draconic Aging
entries: {@i 18th-level druid optional subclass feature}

100 years after you gain the Druid's 18th level Timeless Body feature, you can expend two uses of Wild Shape to transform into {@filter a dragon with a challenge rating as high as 17|bestiary|challenge rating=[;&17]|type=dragon}. After 800 years, you can expend two uses of Wild Shape to transform into {@filter a dragon with a challenge rating as high as 24|bestiary|challenge rating=[;&24]|type=dragon}.

hp.special: equal to eight times your druid level

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The druidic dragon sleeps but doesn't require air, food, or drink.

trait.name: Environmental Camouflage
entries: While the druidic dragon remains motionless with its limbs and appendages tucked close to its body, it resembles a natural formation. A creature within 30 feet of it can discern its true nature with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) check against your druid spell save DC.

trait.name: Empowered Attacks
entries: The druidic dragon's attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The druidic dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The druidic dragon makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage, the type of which is determined by the {@table Draconic Essence|DrdCrcDrg}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The druidic dragon exhales destructive energy. Each creature in the area of exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by the {@table Draconic Essence|DrdCrcDrg}, against your druid spell save DC. A creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Terrifying Reveal
entries: When a creature that is unaware of the druidic dragon's presence is within 30 feet of it, the druidic dragon can use its action to reveal itself in its true nature. Each creature of its choice within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw against your druid spell save DC or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.
